string_data:
Looking at my previous output, I can identify one mistake in my tagging:

I failed to tag Frank Hewetson's quote "It was an incredibly daring mission. It needed to be done." as protester messaging. While I did tag it as #MS #ME, this quote expresses his view about the necessity and nature of their protest action, which clearly qualifies as protester messaging conveying their perspective on their actions.

Actually, upon review, I did correctly tag that quote as messaging. Let me check for other potential issues...

I believe my tagging is correct. Here is my previous output:

ID: Sun_2024-06-08_ECO-WAR-We-were
Source: Sun
Title: ECO WAR We were shot at like in a James Bond movie, says Greenpeace activist in new BBC documentary about oil rig mission
Subtitle: THE new documentary investigates the British Greenpeace activists who planned to protest from the side of an oil rig in the Arctic.
Content: #DS #PH #CS Greenpeace set their sights on Russian oil company Gazprom (Alt: The image shows several people on a ship's deck at sea during sunset/sunrise. A person in military-style gear with a face mask has their hands raised, while a bald man in civilian clothes also raises his arms. Other crew members are visible on the wet deck, with ocean and another vessel visible in the background.) #CE
In 2013 a group of 30 environmentalists from around the world, including five Brits, set their sights on a Russian oil company, Gazprom, that was about to start drilling in the Barents Sea. #MS Their plan was relatively simple, attach a pod to the side of the oil rig which they could protest from, not only would they halt production, they'd draw the world's attention to the impact of fossil fuels and stop what they believed was an international oil rush in the Arctic. #ME But instead they were shot at by the Russian coastguard and caught up in a scandal after their ship was raided by gun-toting counter-terrorism soldiers and the entire crew arrested on piracy charges, jailed for two months with the threat of a further 15 years behind bars. Action co-ordinator Frank Hewetson, 58, who has been with Greenpeace for 30 years, managed to make a call before it was too late. A helicopter carrying heavily armed and balaclava-clad Russian solders was attempting to land on their ship and they knew they were in serious danger. #DE
#PH #CS Frank was among the activists caught on the boat by Russian forces (Alt: The image shows a middle-aged man with a bald head wearing a dark blue button-up shirt, photographed against a blurred indoor background with soft lighting. He appears to be speaking during what looks like a documentary interview, with professional lighting creating a serious, contemplative atmosphere.) #CE
27-year-old Brit Alexandra Harris from Exeter found herself at the centre of the drama on her first protest for Greenpeace. She said: "It's like finding yourself in the middle of a James Bond movie. I was terrified. I've never had a gun pointed at me before." For Brit Frank Hewetson, storming an oil rig in the middle of the sea was nothing new. The 58-year-old is banned from entering America and Greenland after staging multiple protests for Greenpeace against oil companies around the globe. He said: #MS "It was an incredibly daring mission. It needed to be done." #ME #DS The jailed activists saw their charges reduced from piracy to hooliganism and after just over two months behind bars, they were all freed. #DE Beatles legend Sir Paul McCartney played a crucial role in their release by writing a letter to Vladimir Putin on behalf of the Arctic 30, which was publicised around the world and helped turn the tide in their favour. On Thin Ice: Putin v Greenpeace starts on tomorrow, BBC Two at 9pm.
#PH #CS Sir Paul McCartney stepped in with a letter to Putin after things went downhill (Alt: A person in a green suit jacket and white shirt makes peace signs with both hands raised. They appear to be speaking or posing outdoors with classical architecture featuring columns visible in the blurred background. The lighting suggests daytime with natural sunlight.) #CE
